topic: Chick-fil-A vs McDonald's revenue per store
combinedResearch:
# COMPLETE RESEARCH: Chick-fil-A vs McDonald's revenue per store

## ROUND 1 - BROAD EXPLORATION
### Financial Data (15 queries):
Q: What is Chick-fil-A's average revenue per store in 2023?
A: Chick-fil-A's average unit revenues for non-mall locations in 2023 reached a record $9.3 million. ([NRN](https://www.nrn.com/quick-service/chick-fil-a-continues-to-gain-market-share-while-setting-another-average-unit-volume-record)) The average annual sales volume was $9.374 million. ([QSR Magazine](https://www.qsrmagazine.com/growth/finance/chick-fil-a-made-over-21-billion-in-2023))


Q: What is McDonald's average revenue per store in 2023?
A: The median annual sales volume of domestic traditional McDonald’s restaurants open at least 1 year as of December 31, 2023 was $3,837,000. ([Franchise Chatter](https://www.franchisechatter.com/2024/10/13/fdd-talk-mcdonalds-franchise-costs-fees-average-revenues-and-or-profits-2024-review))


Q: How does Chick-fil-A's revenue per store compare to McDonald's in 2023?
A: In 2023, Chick-fil-A's non-mall locations generated average unit revenues of nearly $9.4 million, while McDonald's earned nearly $4 million. ([local12.com](https://local12.com/news/offbeat/chick-fil-a-tramples-mcdonalds-key-revenue-statistic-business-booms-across-nation-average-revenue-per-unit-arpu-volumes-five-guys-chris-kempczinski-affordability-mall-nonmall-consumer-trends-shift-shifting-fast-food-giant-concerns-inflation-awareness?-fbpost))


Q: What is the projected revenue per store for Chick-fil-A in 2024?
A: The average annual sales volume for a Chick-fil-A location in 2024 was $9.317 million. ([QSR Magazine](https://www.qsrmagazine.com/story/chick-fil-as-sales-surpassed-22-billion-in-2024))


Q: What is the projected revenue per store for McDonald's in 2024?
A: The average annual sales volume of traditional franchised McDonald's in 2024 was $3.966 million. ([QSR Magazine](https://www.qsrmagazine.com/story/mcdonalds-made-a-big-growth-push-in-2024))


Q: What was Chick-fil-A's revenue per store in 2022?
A: $6.71 million ([Wikipedia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Chick-fil-A))


Q: What was McDonald's revenue per store in 2022?
A: $23.183 billion. ([Macrotrends](https://www.macrotrends.net/stocks/charts/MCD/mcdonalds/revenue))


Q: What is the growth rate of Chick-fil-A's revenue per store from 2022 to 2023?
A: Chick-fil-A's average unit volume for non-mall locations increased by 8.1% from 2022 to 2023. ([NRN](https://www.nrn.com/quick-service/chick-fil-a-continues-to-gain-market-share-while-setting-another-average-unit-volume-record))


Q: What is the growth rate of McDonald's revenue per store from 2022 to 2023?
A: 9.  97% ([Macrotrends.net](https://www.macrotrends.net/stocks/charts/MCD/mcdonalds/revenue))


Q: What are the average costs associated with operating a Chick-fil-A store in 2023?
A: The initial franchise fee is $10,000, with a total initial investment ranging from $444,243 to $2,338,786. Ongoing fees include a base operating service fee of 15% of sales. ([Franchiseba](https://www.franchiseba.com/chick-fil-a-franchise), [Lendingtree](https://www.lendingtree.com/business/small/how-to-finance-a-chick-fil-a-franchise), [Businessinsider](https://www.businessinsider.com/mcdonalds-chick-fil-a-taco-bell-fast-food-franchise-costs-2019-5))


Q: What are the average costs associated with operating a McDonald's store in 2023?
A: The total estimated costs to open a McDonald's franchise range from $1.47 million to $2.64 million. ([Investopedia](https://www.investopedia.com/articles/insights/072516/cost-buying-mcdonalds-franchise-mcd.asp), [Franchise Direct](https://www.franchisedirect.com/information/how-much-does-it-cost-to-open-a-mcdonalds)) Ongoing fees include a monthly royalty fee of 4% or 5% of gross sales, along with advertising and marketing fees. ([Investopedia](https://www.investopedia.com/articles/insights/072516/cost-buying-mcdonalds-franchise-mcd.asp))


Q: What is the profit margin for Chick-fil-A per store in 2023?
A: The average annual profit for a Chick-fil-A franchise is between $150,000 to $300,000 per store. ([Parnell Woodard](https://pwoodard.esourcecoach.com/understanding-chick-fil-a-profit-per-store-an-in-depth-tutorial-for-franchise-owners))


Q: What is the profit margin for McDonald's per store in 2023?
A: McDonald's net profit margin was 33.22% as of December 31, 2023. ([Macrotrends](https://www.macrotrends.net/stocks/charts/MCD/mcdonalds/profit-margins))


Q: How does the revenue per store of Chick-fil-A in 2024 compare to McDonald's in 2024?
A: In 2024, Chick-fil-A's average annual sales volume per store was $9.317 million. ([QSR Magazine](https://www.qsrmagazine.com/story/chick-fil-as-sales-surpassed-22-billion-in-2024)) McDonald's annual revenue for 2024 was $25.92 billion. ([Macrotrends](https://www.macrotrends.net/stocks/charts/MCD/mcdonalds/revenue)) However, the search results do not provide the revenue per store for McDonald's in 2024, so a direct comparison cannot be made.


Q: What are the expected changes in revenue per store for Chick-fil-A and McDonald's in 2024?
A: In 2024, Chick-fil-A's drive-thrus posted average sales of $9.227 million, while McDonald's average unit volume neared $4 million ([LinkedIn](https://www.linkedin.com/posts/dannyklein14_its-that-time-of-year-again-when-we-peel-activity-7313259812429922305-RwvR), [RestaurantBusinessOnline](https://www.restaurantbusinessonline.com/financing/chick-fil-unit-volumes-stand-alone-restaurants-hit-9m-last-year)). Chick-fil-A's non-mall locations generated average unit revenues of $9.4 million ([RestaurantBusinessOnline](https://www.restaurantbusinessonline.com/financing/chick-fil-unit-volumes-stand-alone-restaurants-hit-9m-last-year)).


### Strategic Research:
Chick-fil-A's total revenue for 2023 was approximately $21.6 billion, generated from around 2,964 locations. This results in an estimated revenue per store of about $7.29 million in 2023 ([Wikipedia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Chick-fil-A), [QSR Magazine](https://www.qsrmagazine.com/growth/finance/chick-fil-a-made-over-21-billion-in-2023)). In comparison, McDonald's reported a total revenue of approximately $25.49 billion for 2023 ([Macrotrends](https://www.macrotrends.net/stocks/charts/MCD/mcdonalds/revenue)). However, the exact number of McDonald's stores in 2023 was not available within the research scope, preventing a direct calculation of revenue per store for McDonald's. Despite this, it is known that McDonald's operates over 39,000 outlets globally, which significantly dilutes its revenue per store compared to Chick-fil-A's more concentrated store count ([Wikipedia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/McDonald%27s)).

Factors influencing revenue differences include store size and operational scale; Chick-fil-A's stores tend to be smaller but highly efficient, with a focus on customer experience and menu pricing that supports high sales volume per location. McDonald's, with a larger global footprint, benefits from economies of scale, extensive menu options, and higher overall sales volume, but its revenue per store is likely lower due to the sheer number of outlets and varying regional performance. Additionally, Chick-fil-A's strategic focus on high-quality service and limited menu offerings allows for higher average sales per store, whereas McDonald's broad menu and global reach generate substantial total revenue but with lower per-store figures. Overall, Chick-fil-A's revenue per store in 2023 was approximately $7.29 million, reflecting its efficient, high-margin operation model, while McDonald's total revenue underscores its vast scale and global presence.

Q: What is Chick-fil-A's average revenue per store in 2023?
A: $9.37 million ([nrn.com](https://www.nrn.com/quick-service/chick-fil-a-continues-to-gain-market-share-while-setting-another-average-unit-volume-record), [franchisetimes.com](https://www.franchisetimes.com/franchise_finance/chick-fil-a-tops-21-billion-in-systemwide-sales-as-unit-volumes-hit-9-4/article_f5b320a0-f357-11ee-b627-37c8b7663f53))

A: Chick-fil-A franchisees typically experience profit margins between 20% and 30%. ([Parnell Woodard](https://pwoodard.esourcecoach.com/understanding-average-profit-in-chick-fil-a-franchises-a-complete-tutorial-for-aspiring-owners))


Q: What are McDonald's profit margins in 2023?
A: McDonald's net profit margin was 33.05% as of June 30, 2023. ([Macrotrends](https://www.macrotrends.net/stocks/charts/MCD/mcdonalds/profit-margins))


Q: What is the average operational cost per store for Chick-fil-A in 2023?
A: The search results do not provide the exact average operational cost per store for Chick-fil-A in 2023. However, they do provide information on initial and ongoing costs for franchisees.


Q: What is the average operational cost per store for McDonald's in 2023?
A: McDonald's annual operating expenses for 2023 were $13.847 billion. ([Macrotrends.net](https://www.macrotrends.net/stocks/charts/MCD/mcdonalds/operating-expenses))


Q: How does Chick-fil-A's customer service model impact its revenue per store in 2023?
A: Chick-fil-A's customer service model, emphasizing efficiency and community ties, significantly impacts its revenue per store. In 2023, Chick-fil-A's revenue per store was $21.6 billion. ([Wikipedia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Chick-fil-A)) The company's focus on operational efficiency, streamlined processes, and a unique franchise model with hands-on owner-operators contributes to high customer satisfaction and repeat business. ([Matrix BCG](https://matrixbcg.com/blogs/how-it-works/chick-fil-a), [Momos](https://www.momos.com/blog/why-chick-fil-a-makes-9-4m-per-store-and-what-weve-learned)) This model has helped Chick-fil-A achieve an average of $9.4 million in sales per store, nearly double that of competitors. ([Momos](https://www.momos.com/blog/why-chick-fil-a-makes-9-4m-per-store-and-what-weve-learned))

A: McDonald's reported a 9% increase in global comparable sales for 2023, demonstrating strong performance across all segments. ([McDonald's Reports Fourth Quarter and Full Year 2023 Results](https://corporate.mcdonalds.com/corpmcd/our-stories/article/Q4-2023-results.html)) The company's systemwide sales to loyalty members exceeded $20 billion for the full year. ([McDonald's Reports Fourth Quarter and Full Year 2023 Results](https://corporate.mcdonalds.com/corpmcd/our-stories/article/Q4-2023-results.html))


Q: What is the franchise fee for opening a Chick-fil-A in 2023?
A: The initial franchise fee is $10,000. ([LendingTree](https://www.lendingtree.com/business/small/how-to-finance-a-chick-fil-a-franchise), [Chick-fil-A](https://www.chick-fil-a.com/franchise), [Business Insider](https://www.businessinsider.com/what-it-costs-to-open-a-chick-fil-a-2016-1), [FranchiseBA](https://www.franchiseba.com/chick-fil-a-franchise))


Q: What is the franchise fee for opening a McDonald's in 2023?
A: The initial franchise fee for opening a McDonald's is $45,000. ([Biz2Credit](https://www.biz2credit.com/franchise-loans/how-much-cost-start-mcdonalds-franchise), [Investopedia](https://www.investopedia.com/articles/insights/072516/cost-buying-mcdonalds-franchise-mcd.asp), [Franchise Direct](https://www.franchisedirect.com/information/how-much-does-it-cost-to-open-a-mcdonalds), [Swoop Funding](https://swoopfunding.com/ca/business-loans/franchise-finance/mcdonalds-franchise))


Q: What are the consumer preferences influencing Chick-fil-A's revenue in 2023?
A: Consumer preferences influencing Chick-fil-A's revenue in 2023 include a preference for chicken sandwiches, with consumers choosing the product over the brand or price. Chick-fil-A's focus on customer service and high-quality food has contributed to its strong brand reputation and customer loyalty, leading to high customer satisfaction ratings. ([nrn.com](https://www.nrn.com/sandwich-trends/consumers-choose-chicken-sandwiches-based-on-the-product-not-restaurant-brand-or-price), [thestrategystory.com](https://thestrategystory.com/blog/chick-fil-a-swot-analysis)) The chain's commitment to family values and community engagement also resonates with customers. ([marstudio.com](https://www.marstudio.com/blog/2024/01/chick-fil-a-marketing-strategy))


Q: What are the consumer preferences influencing McDonald's revenue in 2023?
A: Consumer preferences influencing McDonald's revenue in 2023 include taste, quality, choice, value, and nutrition, with the company continuously evolving its menu to meet customer expectations ([PDF] Annual Report - McDonald's Corporation). McDonald's also focuses on providing affordable, convenient, and consistent fast food ([Blog by Supliful](https://supliful.com/blog/mcdonalds-business-model)). In 2023, global comparable sales grew by 9%, and guest counts grew by 3% globally ([PDF] Annual Report - McDonald's Corporation).


Q: How do operational efficiencies at Chick-fil-A compare to those at McDonald's in 2023?
A: In 2023, Chick-fil-A's average unit volumes for non-mall locations reached a record $9.3 million, an 8.1% increase over 2022's record of $8.67 million. ([nrn.com](https://www.nrn.com/quick-service/why-chick-fil-a-s-only-competitor-is-mcdonald-s)) McDonald's average unit volume is approximately $4 million. ([pos.toasttab.com](https://pos.toasttab.com/blog/on-the-line/most-profitable-fast-food-chains)) Chick-fil-A's focus on customer retention and operational efficiency contributes to its higher per-store revenue compared to McDonald's. ([linkedin.com](https://www.linkedin.com/posts/marquel-russell_chick-fil-a-makes-9374-million-per-store-activity-7379191919970656257-FtNK))


### Strategic Research:
# Comparative Analysis of Revenue per Store: McDonald's vs. Chick-fil-A in 2023

## Revenue per Store Calculation
In 2023, McDonald's operated approximately 41,822 stores globally, generating a total revenue of about $25.49 billion. Dividing the total revenue by the number of stores yields a revenue per store of roughly **$608,592**. This figure is significantly lower than Chick-fil-A's reported revenue per store of **$9.3 million** in the same year, highlighting a stark difference in per-store performance between the two chains.

## Operational Factors Influencing Revenue Differences
### Location Strategy
McDonald's extensive global footprint includes over 13,500 outlets in the U.S. alone, strategically placed in urban, suburban, and rural areas to maximize volume, especially through drive-thrus ([LocationsCloud, 2025](https://locationscloud.com/research-report/mcdonalds-chick-fil-a-usa)). Chick-fil-A, with approximately 3,059 outlets primarily in the South and suburban regions, focuses on high-traffic locations that support higher sales per store ([LocationsCloud, 2025](https://locationscloud.com/research-report/mcdonalds-chick-fil-a-usa)).

### Business Model: Franchise vs. Corporate-Owned
McDonald's predominantly operates through a franchise model, which allows rapid expansion but involves franchise fees and royalties that can limit profit margins per store ([Innovorder, 2024](https://www.innovorder.com/en/blog/how-can-you-maximize-your-fast-food-revenues)). Chick-fil-A, while also franchised, maintains a more controlled expansion strategy emphasizing quality and customer service, which contributes to higher revenue per store.

### Menu Pricing and Customer Experience
Chick-fil-A emphasizes premium menu offerings, exceptional customer service, and a unique Sunday closure policy, fostering customer loyalty and enabling higher pricing strategies ([Reddit, 2025](https://www.reddit.com/r/stupidquestions/comments/1o6y537/why_does_chickfila_have_such_great_customer)). McDonald's offers a broader menu with a focus on affordability and convenience, which drives high volume but results in lower revenue per store ([Quora, 2023](https://www.quora.com/Which-is-the-king-of-fast-food-McDonalds-or-Chick-fil-A)).

### Store Footprint and Drive-Thru Efficiency
Larger store footprints and optimized drive-thru operations significantly boost throughput and sales. Chick-fil-A’s investment in drive-thru innovations and high service standards contribute to its high per-store revenue ([Innovorder, 2024](https://www.innovorder.com/en/blog/how-can-you-maximize-your-fast-food-revenues)). McDonald's also benefits from drive-thru dominance, especially in the U.S., but with a broader store footprint that balances volume with operational costs.

### Operating Hours and Customer Service
Chick-fil-A’s focus on superior customer service and operational hours aligned with customer preferences enhances loyalty and sales. McDonald's extensive operating hours and global reach support high volume but with a different operational focus ([ResearchGate, 2025](https://www.researchgate.net/publication/363370741_Influential_Factors_of_Sales_Revenue_in_the_Fast-Food_Industry)).

### Digital and Sales Channel Integration
Both chains have expanded into digital ordering, delivery, and click-and-collect services. Chick-fil-A’s strategic expansion into delivery and digital kiosks has contributed to its high sales per store, whereas McDonald's leverages its scale and technological investments to maintain high throughput ([Innovorder, 2024](https://www.innovorder.com/en/blog/how-can-you-maximize-your-fast-food-revenues)).

## Summary
The substantial difference in revenue per store between McDonald's (~$608,592) and Chick-fil-A ($9.3 million) is primarily driven by operational strategies. Chick-fil-A’s focus on high-quality service, premium menu offerings, strategic location choices, and efficient drive-thru operations enable it to generate significantly higher revenue per store despite having fewer outlets. Conversely, McDonald's extensive global presence, broader menu, and volume-driven approach result in a lower per-store revenue but a vastly larger total footprint and market reach.

([Locationscloud](https://www.locationscloud.com/research-report/mcdonalds-chick-fil-a-usa))


### Strategic Research:
# Comparative Analysis of Chick-fil-A and McDonald's in 2023

## Revenue Per Store
In 2023, Chick-fil-A's average revenue per store was approximately $6.44 million. This figure was derived from a total revenue of about $21.6 billion across roughly 3,355 stores in the United States ([Chick-fil-A Revenue](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Chick-fil-A), [ScrapeHero](https://www.scrapehero.com/location-reports/Chick-Fil-A-USA)). In contrast, McDonald's generated approximately $609,000 per store, based on a total revenue of $25.49 billion and around 41,822 locations ([McDonald's Revenue](https://www.macrotrends.net/stocks/charts/MCD/mcdonalds/revenue), [McDonald's Store Count](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/McDonald%27s)). This indicates that Chick-fil-A's revenue per store is nearly ten times higher than McDonald's in 2023.

## Revenue Growth Rates
Chick-fil-A experienced a revenue growth rate of approximately 14.7% in 2023, increasing from about $18.82 billion in 2022 to $21.59 billion ([Chick-fil-A Growth](https://www.qsrmagazine.com/growth/finance/chick-fil-a-made-over-21-billion-in-2023)). McDonald's growth rate was approximately 9.97%, rising from roughly $23.18 billion in 2022 to $25.49 billion ([McDonald's Growth](https://www.macrotrends.net/stocks/charts/MCD/mcdonalds/revenue)). Chick-fil-A's higher growth rate reflects its expanding market share and operational efficiencies.

## Operational Efficiencies
### Chick-fil-A
Chick-fil-A's operational excellence is exemplified by its highly efficient drive-thru operations, which achieve customer satisfaction scores of around 99% and average wait times slightly above 2.5 minutes ([Restaurant Dive](https://www.restaurantdive.com/news/intouch-insight-drive-thru-ai-speed-satisfaction-taco-bell-chick-fil-a/801721)). The company employs advanced technology, including 'game film' analysis and Lean methodologies, to optimize flow and eliminate bottlenecks ([Lean Blog](https://www.leanblog.org/2025/03/chick-fil-a-lean-game-film)). Its employee training emphasizes consistency, hospitality, and speed, with current employees mentoring new hires to maintain high standards ([Customer Contact Week Digital](https://www.customercontactweekdigital.com/ccw-analyst-insights/articles/chick-fil-a-employee-experience)). Additionally, Chick-fil-A leverages mobile ordering and drive-thru innovations to reduce wait times and streamline service ([Chick-fil-A](https://www.chick-fil-a.com/press-room/drive-thru-behind-the-scenes)).

### McDonald's
McDonald's has invested heavily in automation and AI to enhance operational efficiency. Drive-thrus, which account for about 70% of U.S. sales, utilize Voice-AI and computer vision systems to speed up order processing and reduce errors ([Restaurant Technology News](https://restauranttechnologynews.com/2025/08/mcdonalds-expands-technology-investments-to-drive-speed-loyalty-and-operational-efficiency)). The company has accelerated its digital transformation with AI-powered kitchens and virtual assistants, streamlining workflows and reducing human error ([New Food Magazine](https://www.newfoodmagazine.com/news/254651/mcdonalds-digital-transformation-accelerates-with-ai-cloud-platforms-and-loyalty-focus)). Its supply chain management employs AI and cloud-based systems for demand forecasting, procurement, and waste reduction, contributing to overall efficiency ([Technology Magazine](https://technologymagazine.com/news/how-ai-is-powering-mcdonalds-global-supply-chain)). These technological investments have supported strong financial performance, with systemwide sales increasing by 6% and operating income rising by 8% in 2023 ([McDonald's Annual Report](https://corporate.mcdonalds.com/content/dam/sites/corp/nfl/pdf/2023%20Annual%20Report_vf.pdf)).

## Comparative Summary
Chick-fil-A's significantly higher revenue per store and higher growth rate in 2023 highlight its superior operational efficiency and market penetration at the store level. Its focus on customer service, employee training, and process optimization has driven its performance. Conversely, McDonald's leverages technological innovation, automation, and supply chain optimization to enhance speed and reduce costs, supporting its extensive global footprint and steady growth.

This analysis underscores the distinct strategic approaches of both companies: Chick-fil-A's emphasis on service quality and operational excellence at the store level, and McDonald's' focus on technological innovation and supply chain efficiency to sustain its scale and growth.
